title: Rent Officer Handbook: fair rent registration

body.content: The Rent Officer Handbook is organised according to the types of statutory work undertaken by Rent Officers. Each separate work-stream is listed and then each process is listed on the next level.
The Rent Officer Handbook is organised according to the types of statutory work undertaken by Rent Officers. Each separate work-stream is listed and then each process is listed on the next level.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: application
child_sections.description: Applications to the Rent Officer for the registration of fair rent for qualifying tenancies.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: tenancy information
child_sections.description: Information about the tenancy which the Rent Officer considers under an application to register the rent.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: jurisdiction
child_sections.description: Where the Rent Officer determines whether the tenancy qualifies for the rent to be registered.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: determination
child_sections.description: The Rent Officer's determination of the rent to be registered for the tenancy.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: objection
child_sections.description: When the landlord or tenant disagrees with the Rent Officer's determination of fair rent.

child_sections.title: Fair rent registration: after registration
child_sections.description: Matters considered after the rent has been registered.

change_notes.title: Fair rent registration: tenancy information
change_notes.change_note: The glossary of terms has been removed and an updated version has been published under 'Rent Officer Handbook: general matters related to all Rent Officer work'.

description: This part of the Rent Officer Handbook includes sections: after registration, application, determination, jurisdiction, objection, and tenancy information.
